artist: Harry Sternberg; Publisher: Weyhe Gallery, New York
creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
dimension:
10 1/8 x 10 1/8 in. (25.72 x 25.72 cm) (image, circular)
12 1/8 x 11 1/8 in. (30.8 x 28.26 cm) (sheet, irregular)
inscription:
Signature; Title; Inscription

Titled in pencil, LL: [Construction]

Inscribed on the plate, LL: [Sternberg June 1932]
provenance: [W. Graham Arader III Gallery, New York]
signed: Signed in pencil, LR: [H. Sternberg]; and on plate.
text: Social realist artist Harry Sternberg presents an iconic image of the heroic worker in this unusual depiction of an anonymous riveter working high above the streets of Manhattan. Sternberg casts the man as a hero of the working class, emblematic of the economic and industrial power of the United States.
title: Construction (The Riveter)
